intro: Aegoseris, commonly known as the golden crownflower, is a genus of flowering plants native to North America. It belongs to the sunflower family, Asteraceae, and is characterized by its showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late summer. The plants typically grow in dry, disturbed soils and are often found in prairies and open woodlands. Aegoseris species are herbaceous perennials with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. They play a role in supporting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
